climbs.name: Two Left Feet
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Peggy Buckey, John Courtney 02-1989

content.description:
Start about 40 feet right of

DMB

below a water streak. Climb up the face past two bolts to an anchor.

Peggy brought two left climbing shoes (Boreal Fires), hence the route name.

Rappel with one rope.
content.protection: Two bolts and some small gear.
content.location:
Start about 40 feet right of

DMB

below a water streak.

content.description: This route goes up the right side of a giant boulder just before you get to the Grey Giant.
content.protection: Two or three bolts and a sling on a horn near the top.

content.description:
Start about 100 feet right of

Two Left Feet

and 30 feet to the right of

Dimorphism

. Climb past a bolt to a left-leaning crack/ramp. Face climb up past two more bolts to a ledge with a belay bolt..

Scramble off right.
content.location:
Start about 100 feet right of

Two Left Feet

and 30 feet to the right of

Dimorphism

.

climbs.name: Hyperion
climbs.fa: D. O'Kelley & D. Davis ,1970: FFA - J. Long, K. Worrall, T. Sorenson,  & R. Accomazzo, 1974

content.description:
Begin at the left end of the south face and climb a low angle crack (some loose rock) that eventually becomes steeper and arches right underneath a large roof. The crux (11d), protected by a #00 TCU, black alien, or small stopper, entails committing moves to the portion of the crack where the roof begins. From here, underclings and hand / fist jams for 80 ft. lead to the anchors (sustained 5.10).

A two bolt direct start is possible about 20' right of the normal start and joins the route after the crux making this an easier option (5.11a).

Pitch #2 (5.10) is a short traverse and consists of climbing that is comparable to the latter part of the first pitch.

Pitch #3 (11d) is initially very bouldery and deceptively difficult from the onset. Very small cams / stoppers and two fixed copperheads (solid) protect the hardest moves.

Classic route in a secluded setting.
content.protection: Very small cams to 3.5", doubles for 1/4" to 2", small to medium stoppers. Two bolt (1/4") anchor at top of pitch #1. Small to medium cams for anchor at end of pitch #2. Two bolt (1/4" buttonheads) anchor at end of pitch #3. Two rappels to the ground.

climbs.name: DMB, The
climbs.fa: Randy Vogel and Craig Fry, January 1978.

content.description: Sustained face climbing takes you past three bolts and up to a belay/rappel anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts, with a bolted belay/rappel anchor at the top of the climb.
content.location: Start from the ground, underneath the right end of Hyperion Arch.
